p: Models based on the A1B scenario show that by both 2040 and 2080 only 10% or less of currently available habitat will be suitable in the Grand River Grassland for many plant species (Table 2, Table S1). The few species with relatively high habitat suitability in 2040 such as Dicanthelium spp. (panic grass), S. nutans (Indian grass), and Trifolium repens (white clover) are predicted to undergo a substantial decrease to their habitat suitability by 2080. The only species that shows high habitat suitability from in 2080 is Vernonia baldwinii (Baldwin's ironweed).
